title: Desktop Publisher Designer-Manager
content:
About Ogilvy 
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.
About the Role 
The Desktop Publisher Designer-Manager will collaborate closely with a wide range of teams across our FEMA client, to transform desktop publishing needs into exceptional experiences by leveraging expertise in design principles and information design. With support of the Creative Director, the Desktop Designer-Manager will lead projects that primarily require the use of Microsoft PowerPoint and Word, but also use of the Adobe Creative Suite, through all phases of the design process.
What you will do:

Manage as well as execute various FEMA project assignments
Manage and mentor desktop publishers and/or production artists that report to you
Collaborate with other departments to manage workflow and project assignments 
Provide assessment/performance feedback to direct reports 
Identify opportunities for efficiencies in materials development and provide training/coaching where necessary 
Work directly with functional area managers to resolve issues that impact completion of project objectives 
Drive for results and timely decision-making 
Regularly assess quality of design, layout illustration, creative development, pre-press, proofreading and photography or materials 
Work with stakeholders to interpret and transform raw data into clear and compelling charts, graphs, icons, graphics and other visual representations to convey information in an easily digestible format 
Produce materials while ensuring 508-compliance as well as corporate brand consistency, visual identity, and layout for print or digital output 
Utilize Microsoft Word and PPT as well as Adobe Creative Suite (including InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop) to design and format documents including long-format reports, handbooks and/or guidebooks, posters, signage and other materials  
Review and proofread proposal materials to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to company guidelines 
Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, adhering to deadlines and prioritizing tasks effectively  
Coordinate with stakeholders to gather necessary information, clarify design requirements, and provide project updates 
Monitor hours spent on projects to not exceed budgets 

What you will need:

Self-starting, organized, detail-oriented person with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment 
7+ years of experience in described areas of oversight 
Advanced experience with Microsoft 365, including Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint 
Extensive knowledge using styles to format Word documents and developing templates for large, complex documents 
Advanced experience using Adobe Acrobat Pro 
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop) 
Understanding of color management, print quality management and industry standard printing methods 
Understanding of digital file development and production 
Successful experience leading a diverse group of employees including management of direct reports 
Strong written and oral communication skills with experience in communicating and presenting to internal and external clients 
Working knowledge in video editing software preferred but not required, with ability to trim and compile recorded webinar videos

How We’ll Support You
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
